Confront.definition: to face or bring face-to-face for the purpose of challenging esp. through cross-examination [the accused shall enjoy the right…to be ed with the witnesses against him " U.S. Constitution amend. VI"] con·fron·ta·tion   [kÄ n-frən-tā-shən] n
Confront.origin: [the accused shall enjoy the right…to be ed with the witnesses against him " U.S. Constitution amend. VI"]
